data.title: Nick Greiner’s record number of board seats
data.meta_description: The Australian directors' club is way too tight so Crikey is going to start tracking who has held the most number of board seats. First out of the blocks is Nick Greiner and we doubt we'll find anyone busier than him.
data.text:
The Australian directors’ club is way too tight so Crikey is going to

start tracking who has held the most number of board seats. First out

of the blocks is Nick Greiner and we doubt we’ll find anyone busier

than him.

Former NSW Premier Nick Greiner is an obvious starting point

given he is chairing the $300 million-plus Bradken steel float which

was launched on April 27. Since resigning from the NSW Parliament in

1992, these are all the directorships that we know Greiner has held and

if anyone can beat this please email boss @crikey.com.au.

Chairman dstore

Chairman Bradken

Chairman British American Tobacco Australasia

Chairman Baulderstone Hornibrook Australia

Chairman Iama

Chairman United Utilities Australia

Chairman CRC for Biopharmaceutical Research Pty Ltd

Chairman Australian Subscription TV and Radio Association (ASTRA)

Chairman Nuance Global Traders

Chairman BMC Media

Chairman of wool company AWG

Deputy chairman Stockland Trust Property Group

Deputy chairman Coles Myer

Deputy chairman Castle Harlan Australia

Director QBE

Director Australian Stationery Industries

Director South Sydney District Rugby League Football Club

Director SOCOG

Director Brian McGuigan Wines

Director Supertex Industries

Consultant to Phillips

Consultant to PricewaterhouseCoopers

Consultant to Deloittes Touche Tohmatsu

Consultant to Clayton Utz

Consultant to Turnbull Porter Novelli

Consultant to Salomon Smith Barney

CRIKEY: That is an impressive tally of 11 chairs, three deputy

chairs, five directorships and six consultancies. Is it any wonder that

Greiner is said to be one of the richest retired politicians in

Australia?

Naturally, he pulls that taxpayer funded pension

in whilst getting paid for all these gigs. It would be interesting to

chart the matrix between the Greiner consultancies and work given to

the firms he chaired over the years. This sort of thing is distinctly

passe in 2004 as directors strive to be completely independent.

However,

this hasn’t stopped Greiner keeping his snout in the consultancy trough

as the 2004 Who’s Who reveals that the Deloitte and Citigroup (owner of

Salomons) gigs are ongoing.

The amazing Dick Warburton workload

Crikey is sitting on a panel with Dick Warburton at the

Australian Institute of Company Directors annual conference in Port

Douglas next week so we may as well lay out his huge portfolio of

directorships over the years.

Managing Director Du Pont Australia

Chairman Caltex

Chairman Star City Casino

Chairman David Jones

Chairman Goldfields Kalgoorlie

Chairman Gibson Chemicals

Chairman Board of Taxation

Chairman AurionGold

Chairman NSW Olympic Business Roundtable

Chairman AusIndustry

Chairman Wool International

Chairman Worksafe Australia

Chairman HIH Claims Support Company

President Plastics and Chemicals Industry Association

President Australian Institute of Company Directors

President American Chamber of Commerce

Director Tabcorp

Director Southcorp

Director Nufarm

Director Fernz Corp

Director Heart Research Institute

Director Reserve Bank

Director Note Printing Australia

Director Allen Allen & Hemsley

Director Microsearch Foundation

Director O’Connell Street Associates
